title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:08 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
00:11 <lucaa1> has joined #xwiki  
00:14 <lucaa> has quit  
00:17 <@sdumitriu> Danker: Which one do you like more, Gentoo or Debian?  
00:18 <Enygma`> has quit  
00:20 <Danker> sdumitriu: Gentoo  
00:20 <@sdumitriu> Great  
00:20 <Danker> if for my personal preference  
00:20 <Danker> I would install debian for others x)  
00:21 <Danker> sdumitriu: Why are you asking?  
00:21 <@sdumitriu> Just wanted to know  
00:22 <@sdumitriu> Few people like Gentoo  
00:22 <@sdumitriu> I think it's the best  
00:24 <Danker> :)  
00:24 <Danker> I think too  
00:24 <Danker> Some time ago I was looking into Arch  
00:25 <Danker> But they Rolling releases wasn't such painless as I would have wanted... x)  
00:33 <lucaa1> has quit  
00:46 <fmancinelli> has quit  
00:49 <pouyanster> has joined #xwiki  
00:49 <pouyanster> hi! any GSoC mentors online?  
00:49 <@sdumitriu> Sure  
00:50 <pouyanster> great! I had a question about calendar project (Marta suggested to discuss it with mentors here)  
00:50 <@sdumitriu> Summoning her...  
00:50 <pouyanster> I was told that it is mainly a UI project  
00:50 <@sdumitriu> But you can talk with me too  
00:51 <pouyanster> great  
00:51 <marta\_> has joined #xwiki  
00:52 <pouyanster> Im somehow confused marta told me that it is mainly UI oriented however the wiki page states "This application was removed from the default distribution of XWiki "  
00:52 <pouyanster> so is it necessary to rebuild the application or not?  
00:53 <@sdumitriu> Yes, but applications in XWiki are easy to do  
00:53 <@sdumitriu> That's why most of the work will be on the UI  
00:53 <pouyanster> ok  
00:54 <marta\_> hi pouyanster  
00:54 <pouyanster> another question is if it is allowed to used third party JS frameworks  
00:54 <pouyanster> hi marta :)  
00:54 <marta\_> i guess sdumitriu answered your first question :)  
00:54 <pouyanster> yes he/she has  
00:54 <marta\_> about js: we're using prototype in xwiki  
00:54 <@sdumitriu> It's allowed to use JS frameworks, but it's recommended to stick to the ones we already use  
00:54 <marta\_> some scriptaculous  
00:54 <@sdumitriu> Prototype+Scriptaculous  
00:55 <@sdumitriu> So adding JQuery is seriously frowned upon  
00:55 <@sdumitriu> Adding a library built on Prototype is OK  
00:55 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
00:55 <pouyanster> i was thinking of ExtJS or Dojo for some great UI components  
00:56 <marta\_> it shouldn't be necessary  
00:57 <pouyanster> very well  
00:57 <marta\_> scriptaculous is powerful enough for what we have in mind  
00:57 <@sdumitriu> JS should not be an essential part  
00:57 <pouyanster> so let me get this clear  
00:57 <@sdumitriu> Ideally, the application should work without any JS at all  
00:58 <@sdumitriu> JS should enhance the functionality  
00:58 <marta\_> yes, i guess this is getting kind of confusing for you :)  
00:58 <marta\_> so:  
00:58 <@sdumitriu> Dojo usually tends to build everything from JS, so without JS there's no application  
00:58 <pouyanster> most functionalities are already available in XWiki's core, only UI is to be implemented!  
00:58 <@sdumitriu> Which is wrong  
00:59 <marta\_> 1/ the programming (data manipulation) is done with velocity + xwiki api  
00:59 <@sdumitriu> XWiki is an application framework, so it's not quite true that the functionality for the calendar application is available  
00:59 <Danker> pouyanster: ExtJS would not "fit" for its "intrusing" design unless you are willing to create a new theme which is quite a pain...  
00:59 <@sdumitriu> Most of it is, and the rest is just building an application on top of the framework  
01:00 <marta\_> 2/ after you make everything work with just that, you add the JS enhancements to create a better user expeience  
01:00 <pouyanster> ok  
01:01 <pouyanster> now I got it. I think my application was somehow misleading  
01:03 <pouyanster> I was planning to implement an MVC based application which uses XWiki's data model as its model, and HTML/JSP/Velocity/etc. as its view and a core layer as its controller  
01:04 <pouyanster> thanks everyone for the guidance  
01:05 <marta\_> you're welcome, looking forward for the application update  
01:05 <pouyanster> im on it!  
01:13 <@sdumitriu> Danker: I can't see your nosql application, did you remove it?  
01:13 <@sdumitriu> It works if I open it directly, but it's not listed  
01:14 <Danker> It is shown for me....  
01:14 <Danker> Check search filter :D  
01:14 <@sdumitriu> Could be a bug in Melange  
01:15 <Danker> Could be  
01:15 <Danker> Last year I was left out of GSOC because of bug in birth date selection widget...  
01:16 <@sdumitriu> But they just started sending mail notifications, I wonder how many other proposals were lost before they started sending notifications  
01:17 <@sdumitriu> Going over to #gsoc to check  
01:22 <@sdumitriu> Danker: The problem seems to be that you withdrew the application  
01:28 <Danker> sdumitriu: Is it visible now? Just updated status.  
01:28 <+marta\_> yes it is  
01:28 <@sdumitriu> Yep, looks good  
01:47 <pouyanster> has quit

06:06 <qwebirc91065> has joined #xwiki  
06:08 <qwebirc91065> I’m a computer science third year student who willing to participate for GSOC 2011 and i am interested in Specific WikiMacro Editors project idea. I would like to know further details on this topic. Looking forward to hear from you. Thanks in advance.  
06:10 <@cjdelisle> I don't know much about that project but people who do will be around in about 4 hours.  
06:12 <qwebirc91065> ok. thanks a lot

10:15 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:23 <mflorea> has quit

10:32 <Chami1> has joined #xwiki  
10:48 <vmassol> sburjan: hi  
10:55 <sbose78> has joined #xwiki  
10:56 <sbose78> cjdelisle: Hello, you there?  
10:56 <@cjdelisle> howdy  
10:57 <sbose78> I have submitted the application , I guess its a bit lengthy. Could you please go through it and tell ne what changes to make? ( what to add and what to remove)  
10:57 <sbose78> I see the project name "XWiki to Appengine" has changed.  
10:58 <sbose78> Though the contents remain same.  
11:01 <@cjdelisle> hmm can't view it.  
11:01 <@cjdelisle> Half the time google thinks I'm logged in and half the time it thinks I'm logged out  
11:02 <ihalip> maybe you can put it on google docs, i did the same thing - editing is much easier, and both mentors and other students can see it  
11:02 <qwebirc23952> has quit  
11:03 <@cjdelisle> works now o\_O  
11:04 <@cjdelisle> "Now, Since XWQL lacks a proper specification" lol  
11:05 <sbose78> :D  
11:05 <sbose78> No, i went through your posts in the mailing list.  
11:06 <sbose78> I found them very intuitive  
11:07 <@cjdelisle> "encrypted IDs for registration systems using RSA"  
11:08 <@cjdelisle> how did that project go?  
11:10 <sbose78> The project went well.  
11:11 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:11 <sbose78> I used it for a registration system to encrypt phone nummbers.  
11:11 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
11:12 <@cjdelisle> I'm not thinking of anything off the top of my head which needs changing.  
11:12 <sbose78> The problem I noticed was when the number of bits of encryption was made less.. the encryption became weak !  
11:12 <sbose78> I;m sorry I didn't get you.  
11:13 <@cjdelisle> Today I'm banging my head against an OSGi thing so I can't be too much help.  
11:13 <sbose78> Okay sure, hey I need to leave now, Please go through the proposal and mail me if I need to make modifcations  
11:14 <sbose78> Thanks a lot !  
11:14 <sbose78> All the best for the OSGi thing :-p  
11:15 <@cjdelisle> yea :/  
11:16 <vmassol> tmortagne: wdyt of removing one level for xwiki-platform-configuration?  
11:17 <vmassol> right now it's xwiki-plafform-configuration/xwiki-platform-configuration-default  
11:17 <vmassol> I'm not sure  
11:17 <vmassol> I'm hesitating  
11:17 <+tmortagne> vmassol: let me check something  
11:18 <+tmortagne> currently we don't have any implementation of configuration API in commons, right ?  
11:18 <vmassol> let me check  
11:18 <+tmortagne> seems a problem to me  
11:18 <vmassol> no we just have the api there  
11:18 <+tmortagne> makes it almost unusable outside of XWiki  
11:18 <vmassol> sure  
11:18 <vmassol> in the future  
11:18 <vmassol> the idea  
11:18 <vmassol> is to have the main config there  
11:18 <vmassol> main = properties file  
11:18 <vmassol> or something like that  
11:18 <+tmortagne> same for observation btw  
11:19 <vmassol> yes  
11:19 <vmassol> but that doesn't change the question for platform  
11:19 <sbose78> has quit  
11:19 <vmassol> since there are xwiki platform related class in config-defaut  
11:19 <vmassol> so that module will stay anyway  
11:19 <+tmortagne> well part of it will move  
11:19 <vmassol> (at least for the user/wiki/space configimpls)  
11:20 <vmassol> only the generic part  
11:20 <vmassol> yes  
11:20 <vmassol> but the module will stay  
11:20 <vmassol> so the question is should we make it a top level module agian  
11:20 <+tmortagne> so maybe we will them have several module, one for each configuration extension  
11:20 <vmassol> instead of having it nested  
11:20 <vmassol> I don't think we need that  
11:20 <+tmortagne> xwiki related extension  
11:20 <vmassol> for suer/space/wiki  
11:20 <vmassol> they can go together  
11:20 <+tmortagne> yea maybe  
11:20 <vmassol> ok I'm leaving it like it is now if you're not sure  
11:21 <+tmortagne> let's say i'm +0  
11:21 <vmassol> ok not changing now  
11:21 <+tmortagne> even if we want to gave several module latter we can refactorr back it's not a big issue  
11:21 <+tmortagne> s/gave/have/  
11:37 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
11:38 <+tmortagne> vmassol, cjdelisle: WDYT about grouping crypto and csrf under the same "secutity" parent or something like that ?  
11:38 <@cjdelisle> It makes some sense. Also captcha fits in the same category too.  
11:38 <vmassol> +1 but not right now (need to finish my refactoring first)  
11:39 <+tmortagne> yep did not tough about captcha but +1 to add it too  
11:40 <+tmortagne> vmassol: ok, let me know when it's ready enough (unless you do it)  
11:41 <vmassol> I think I need 1-2 hours more  
11:41 <vmassol> I'll ping you  
11:41 <+tmortagne> ok thanks  
11:52 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
11:59 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
12:02 <@cjdelisle>     <!-- Standard dependencies used in several XWiki build modules. Ensures all modules  
12:02 <@cjdelisle>          use the same version for these dependencies -->  
12:02 <@cjdelisle> in commons  
12:03 <@cjdelisle> I disagree with that method. It forced dependencies on packages which may not need them  
12:03 <+vmassol> not true  
12:04 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: it just setup the version to use if you depends on it, does not add it as dependency  
12:04 <+tmortagne> unless you are not talking about root xwiki pom  
12:05 <@cjdelisle> xwiki-commons-pom/pom.xml  
12:06 <+tmortagne> yep that's dependencyManagement not dependencies  
12:06 <+tmortagne> so you don't force anyone to use anything  
12:06 <+tmortagne> just make sure everyone use the same version  
12:06 <@cjdelisle> ahh, sorry. Maven is one of my blind spots.  
12:07 <+tmortagne> actually you don't even make sure since anyone can override this configuration but youallow people to not have to indicate the version  
12:17 <mpaun\_> has joined #xwiki

12:57 <+tmortagne> add github repositories to jira, all except platform tools which don't have repositories on github yet  
12:57 <+vmassol> lunch for me, I'm almost done  
12:57 <+vmassol> just pushed my latest changes  
12:58 <+tmortagne> moving jenkins jobs on git starting with commons and rendering  
12:58 <+vmassol> tmortagne: you sure?  
12:58 <+tmortagne> vmassol: should i do it right now for core too ?  
12:58 <+vmassol> isn't it a bit early  
12:58 <+vmassol> ah commons  
12:58 <+tmortagne> why ?  
12:58 <+vmassol> renderring  
12:58 <+vmassol> ok  
12:58 <+vmassol> for platform it's a bit early I think  
12:58 <+tmortagne> ok

13:46 <+sburjan> If I want to change the skin to Toucan on a 3.0, I have to address which page contains the Skin Object. What page does contain Toucan Object ?  
13:47 <+sburjan> if a skin is not found, it is defaulted to Albatross  
13:47 <+vmassol> hmmm cannot find the wiki-manager plugin....  
13:54 <+vmassol> tmortagne: any idea where sergiu has put the wiki manager plugin?  
13:54 <+vmassol> I think he forgot it.....  
13:55 <+sburjan> vmassol: could you answer my question ?  
13:56 <+sburjan> (if you know)  
13:56 <+vmassol> just use toucan as the skin  
13:56 <+vmassol> (I guess I don't understand the question)  
13:56 <+sburjan> I have to know what should I put in the Skin input field in the Admin Section  
13:57 <+sburjan> so I can use Toucan  
13:57 <+vmassol> toucan  
13:57 <+vmassol> :)  
13:57 <+vmassol> isn't this in the skin guide?  
13:57 <+vmassol> if not could you update it?  
13:57 <+sburjan> yes, I was putting Toucan :)  
13:57 <+sburjan> that's what I am doing right now :)  
13:57 <+vmassol> well it's the name of the directory on the file system  
13:58 <+sburjan> I see  
13:59 <+sburjan> the default skin name is not a dir name, it is XWiki.DefaultSkin.. and the object refert to the colibri skin. This is why I got confused. Thanks !  
13:59 <@cjdelisle> maven-clover2-plugin  
13:59 <@cjdelisle> <license><![CDATA[.....  
13:59 <+vmassol> yes you can put either a file system skin or an xobject one  
13:59 <@cjdelisle> lol  
13:59 <+vmassol> (sburjan)  
13:59 <+vmassol> cjdelisle: the license isn't hidden, it's for the xwiki dev team  
13:59 <+vmassol> xwiki is encoded inside  
14:00 <@cjdelisle> ahh  
14:00 <+vmassol> and anyone not part of the xwiki dev team and using it is illegal  
14:00 <@cjdelisle> heh so better be careful when you type mvn  
14:00 <+vmassol> right ;)  
14:10 <+sburjan> vmassol: I seesomething odd in the documentation  
14:10 <+vmassol> tmortagne: ping, it's ok now you can introduce xwiki-security if you want. I'm not sure about putting captcha in there. We might want to have a captcha ui too  
14:10 <+sburjan> A Skin can be used at different levels: For a specific user (it has a higher priority then the space level Skin). Do we support/have this ?  
14:12 <+vmassol> I think so yes  
14:12 <+vmassol> you can test it maybe?  
14:12 <+vmassol> (sburjan)  
14:12 <+vmassol> jsut go to your user and edit the object  
14:12 <@cjdelisle> shouldn't captcha ui be seperate from the generator/validator?  
14:13 <+vmassol> cjdelisle: wer're going the opposite irght now  
14:13 <+vmassol> ie gathering together modules related to the same feature  
14:14 <+vmassol> :)  
14:14 <+vmassol> if by separated you mean different modules yes of course  
14:14 <+vmassol> that's what we have  
14:14 <+vmassol> but that doesn't mean they should be under the same umbrella directrory  
14:14 <+vmassol> s/should/shouldn't/  
14:15 <Danker> has quit  
14:15 <+vmassol> basically  
14:15 <+tmortagne> vmassol: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform-core/tree/master/xwiki-platform-wiki-manager  
14:15 <+tmortagne> indeed no plugin  
14:15 <+vmassol> tmortagne: that's the app  
14:15 <+tmortagne> he probably forgot  
14:15 <@cjdelisle> Also the UI doesn't make much sense. Registration or comments should ask for a captcha link then call a function to validate it.  
14:15 <+vmassol> yep  
14:16 <+tmortagne> but he did it in a way he could add the plugin  
14:16 <+vmassol> cjdelisle: I have no idea if it makes sense or not. right now it doesn't. In the fuuture it will  
14:16 <+tmortagne> so he was probably planning to do it  
14:16 <+vmassol> with IX  
14:16 <+vmassol> pushing my latest changes  
14:16 <+tmortagne> re captcha i don't see why adding UI is an issue with xwiki-security  
14:17 <+vmassol> tmortagne: we need to discss that because it's important  
14:17 <@cjdelisle> Then you have an extension which almost fits in every form but still looks just a little goofie everywhere.

15:53 <mbryant> Hey guys I have a question... I am trying to find the underlying soruce code for the WYSIWYG editor, and I cant remember where its located, can someone provide me with the Trunk URL for it please  
15:53 <mpaun> has joined #xwiki  
15:54 <mihaipaun> has joined #xwiki  
15:58 <@cjdelisle> mbryant: http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/web/trunk/  
15:58 <mpaun> has quit  
15:58 <@cjdelisle> That location is fast becoming outdated as we are transitioning to github but everything is there.  
15:59 <mbryant> yea I know your making the move thats why I wasnt sure, I am guessing that the repo will be published once its done, as well as documents updated  
15:59 <@cjdelisle> It's written in java and using GWT it is "compiled" into js.  
15:59 <+vmassol> mbryant: yes we'll udpate everything  
16:01 <mbryant> vmassol: cjdelisle: thanks guys I appreciate the help  
16:01 <@cjdelisle> sure thing  
16:02 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki
